qas.question: How many Estonians chose to retreat or flee when in anticipation of another Soviet invasion?
Which countries did most Estonians desire to flee to?
What was the name of the refugee ship that Estonians boarded?
What date did the Soviet Council of Ministers issue a declaration to remove native Estonians?

context: In the face of the country being re-occupied by the Red Army, <a0_0>tens of thousands<a0_0/> of Estonians (including a majority of the education, culture, science, political and social specialists) chose to either retreat with the Germans or flee to <a1_0>Finland or Sweden<a1_0/> where they sought refuge in other western countries, often by refugee ships such as <a2_0>the SS Walnut<a2_0/>. On <a3_0>12 January 1949<a3_0/>, the Soviet Council of Ministers issued a decree "on the expulsion and deportation" from Baltic states of "all kulaks and their families, the families of bandits and nationalists", and others.
